wikipedia_page.main: Eric Ashby MBE (19 January 1918 – 6 February 2003) was an English naturalist and wildlife cameraman, often working for the BBC Natural History Unit.

response: Actor Paul Rogers narrated a script by Desmond Hawkins. Filming was by  Eric Ashby and Leslie Jackman, the latter filming the insect scenes at his home in Paignton. The 35-minute film was produced by Christopher Parsons. The music was composed and conducted by George Shears and performed by the BBC's West of England Players.
Eric Ashby, Baron Ashby, FRS (24 August 1904 – 22 October 1992) was a British botanist and educator.
The wildlife film maker Eric Ashby lived at Linwood from 1953 until his death in 2003.Mabey, Richard, Introduction to
* Eric Ashby. For services to Wildlife.
*Eric Ashby, 85, English naturalist and wildlife cameraman.
